page.title: 01STRATTON & SOUTH MARSTON
page.content: {Stratton St.Margaret Stratton developed in Saxon times as three villages located near the Roman road of Ermin Street. Since 1950 it has been swallowed up by the rapid growth of the town of{Swindon.}It is now an industrial suburb of Swindon. Several large industrial estates are located in our survey area with a range of engineering and distributive companies. The largest is the Austin Rover Car Body plant. Much of the rest of Stratton consists of modern housing estates. {South Marston South Marston is a small village separated from the growth of Swindon by the expanse of an airfield. The development of the site by the Honda car company may lead to the swallowing up of the village into a greater Swindon.
